data.title: "namespace" as a property name gets highlighted in JavaScript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new JavaScript file.
2. Enter `foo.namespace`.

The property `namespace` gets highlighted, however I don't believe `namespace` has any meaning in JavaScript.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2203377/13899598/47d56630-edea-11e5-9e4a-6b019e7bfdb1.png)

data.title: can't download the installer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 10.11
- OS Version:  windows 10 pro 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  can't download the installer 
2.  also could never update since 0.3 version
   ![screenshot 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11838212/13899530/5d2f504a-ee12-11e5-8a4b-c2783adc29d1.png)

data.title: vscode marketplace shows wrong installation instructions
data.body: For example for my [debugging extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=webfreak.debug) the vscode marketplace says I should do `ext install debug` but when entering that into the console it wants to install [some python extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=donjayamanne.python) as it has `debug` in its description and is the most downloaded extension. Showing `publisher.extension` in the marketplace would make this more unique

data.title: Support to pass in a name for the diff editor when using --diff

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
--diff=<name> could be optional and used to better indicate a git diff. when this is done should also consider to make the diff editor readonly on both sides.

Related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4144

data.title: Update our node.d.ts to 4.x
update to 4.x node.d.ts
VSCode & Task Output freezing, printing and sleeping
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10

I encountered some odd behaviors in VSCode, when using tasks and the output window.
I'm currently doing some Python and has setup a task, for ease of execution using
<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>B</kbd>.

---

The main issue is that VSCode opens the output window when the task starts (given that `"showOutput": "always"` is true), but output is first appearing when the task has ended.

The following text first appears in the output window 10 seconds after the task is started (i.e. when the task is done).

```
from time import sleep

for i in range(10):
    print(i)
    sleep(1) # seconds
```

---

What makes this further confusing it that the following never prints anything (as expected, due to the above).

```
from time import sleep

while True:
    print("Freeze")
    sleep(1) # seconds
```

But change the delay to 10 milliseconds and suddenly the output window is filled with "Freeze" every 4-10 seconds.

```
from time import sleep

while True:
    print("Freeze")
    sleep(0.01) # seconds
```

I changed the delay to 100 milliseconds instead of 10 milliseconds, and "Freeze" first appeared after 2-3 minutes in the output window.

---

Also removing the sleep command entirely, ends up in VSCode freezing completely.

Something interesting in this case, is that "Freeze" appears once. Then after 10-20 seconds, the output window is then again filled with "Freeze", while VSCode is still totally frozen. While the only solution being to kill VSCode with the task manager.

```
while True:
    print("Freeze")
```

---

Also something that is worth mentioning. As (obviously) it's an output window, and not an input window. When the running task tries to read from the standard input (`raw_input()`/`input()` in Python) the task just stops.

As a feature request it would be nice to have an input/output window, instead of just an output window. If not, then just at least some prompt for closing the running task, instead of just having it frozen and hidden away in the background, not knowing what is happening.

data.title: Why open Unity3d project aways 300%+ cpu usage?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version:OS X 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. use vscode open a c# solution which created by Unity3D
2. open some c# file in vscode
   Your will see cpu usage is more than 300% when first load,it's expect. But if your switch to new c# file in the same project,the backend mono process will use more than 300% cpu again.

![qq20160319-0 2x](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1423545/13896615/43c31960-edcd-11e5-9afc-11f2539b0ccc.png)

data.title: [vb] Make NameOf a keyword for Visual Basic
data.body: This pull request follows up on #4446 by also adding the `NameOf` keyword to the Visual Basic syntax. (Since VB already has exception filters, an additional change to add the `When` keyword is not needed.)

data.title: [c#] Add support for new C# 6 keywords
data.body:
C# 6 introduces two new keywords, `nameof` and `when`. (For reference, here's the [Roslyn wiki](https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/wiki/Languages-features-in-C%23-6-and-VB-14) on the subject which lists all the new features added to C# 6.)

This pull request adds support for the keywords to Razor/general `.cs` files so they'll be syntax highlighted in the editor.

data.title: Multi-line strings in Javascript not being color-coded correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
- 1. Define a variable in a Javascript/Typescript file and assign a multi-line string value, using the "\" (backslash) character to join lines. e.g.

``` javascript
var mlString = "The is my long multi-line string which I am using a backslash \
                to join over these lines."
```
- 2. In the vscode editor only the first line of the string is correctly color-coded as a string-type. See screenshot attached.
  ![multi-line string color coding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12181805/13895716/0f8c2ecc-edcb-11e5-8e9e-2e9358263410.PNG)

data.body:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13895465/ad6add6e-ed30-11e5-90e4-a96e60cbbeca.png)

data.title: Mac: after native crash, sometimes application disappears from dock

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: MAC OS X EI captian (Version 10.11.2)

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  launch app and play around help menu to make application to be crashed (current behavior) or try to perform any action which makes VSCode to be crashed on MAC.
2. Once you get the alert window for crash click on "Reopen" button and verify application behavior.

Actual: 
1. VSCode re-launched successfully but it is not displaying in the active program list at the bottom right corner where all the active programs are listed.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13892695/5bb66534-ed16-11e5-8756-78ae41f72e50.png)
1. Menu bar at the top is not changing according to VSCode so MAC is unable to recognize VSCode active session. Menu bar items are displaying for the last active window though the focus is on VScode. In my case it was "Safari".
   Note: I am not certain if this is the common behavior on MAC for crashed app.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13892624/e44c1f0c-ed15-11e5-9ee9-3a07fb016b82.png)
3. When I try to uninstall app, it is keep throwing pop-up that the app is running and can't trash. But there is no active session anywhere. I observed that the app stuck with Finder and user has to forcefully close finder first. After forcefully closing finder and re-launching VSCode , it is working as expected.

data.title: Add "Open with Code - Alpha" action to Windows Explorer file context menu shown twice on setup wizard
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12 alpha
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Windows install and work through setup wizard
2. On the Select Additional Task page there are two (unchecked) options "Add "Open with Code - Alpha" action to Windows Explorer file context menu".

Why is this option included twice?  Does the text needed to be updated for one of them?

data.title: Open with Code not visible for unprivileged users
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Log in as a unprivileged user
2. Run the VS Code installer as Administrator and enter password
3. Tap both "Open with Code" checkboxes in the wizard
4. Right-click on a file or folder 

The "Open with Code" option is missing. I have not investigated this more than the reproduce steps above so it may be unrelated to the user being unprivileged.

data.title: Context menu in wrong location after increasing font size
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
  Version 0.10.11
  Commit f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
  Date 2016-03-11T17:10:35.304Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise Version 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VSCode.
2. Press Control + a few times because you're getting older and your monitor is very large. :)
3. Right click on some text. 

Expected result: The context menu opens at the mouse pointer. 

Actual result: The context menu opens at what would be the right location if you hadn't increased the font size. 

Notes: 
1. I could not for the life of me find a way to search these issues, apologies in advance if this is a dupe. 
2. This is a new bug for this update - this didn't used to happen.

data.title: html lang attribute should be set to current locale
data.body: The `<html>` `lang` attribute of the editor is set to `en` regardless of the locale the editor was launched in. [This can cause issues, particularly around CJK fonts](http://www.growingwiththeweb.com/2014/03/languages-and-chinese-characters-on-the-web.html).

data.title: Support callstack with more than 20 stack frames

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04, Window 10

In threads window, currently the depth/level of call stack is hard code limited to 20 frames in debugModel.ts, when there is a deeper call stack the threads window doesn't indicate there are more frames avaiable which is a confusing experience. Please consider:
1) Add some message on UI indicating there are more stack frames available
2) Make the stack depth limitation configurable by debugAdpater

data.title: After 0.10.8, 'Code' executable has been renamed 'code'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: after 0.10.8 dated 02/05, for example 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. after blowing away directory, unzipped in /usr/local/lib  
2. symlink in now broken because 'Code' executable doesn't exist under /usr/local/lib/VSCode-linux-x64

Fixed by:
   Under /usr/local/lib/VSCode-linux-x64, created a 'Code' copy of 'code' executable:

```
> sudo cp code Code
```

After which launcher icon and '> code .' work as expected.

data.title: Incorrect font on overall GUI on Japanese environment
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  0.10.12-insider
- OS Version:
  Windows 10 Build 14291
  Steps to Reproduce:
  -

Basically, VS Code does not use correct Japanese font on VS Code.
It's acceptable on the editor pane if we choose correct font-family.

But recent build introduces Japanese localization on the GUI and
it results in very very ugly look on the status bar and other UI parts.

Some of the glyphs are shown in serif (mincho) font and others are in san-serif (gothic)
and the cause is very apparent; the font is a chinese font, not Japanese one.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311400/13888018/43931224-ed82-11e5-8fde-3cafa885ad50.png)

We need some fix.
Or, there would be some kind of configuration to change the UI font (not editor font).

data.title: Sorting installed extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. F1 -> Show installed extensions

Actual:
Extensions sorted by number of downloads

Expected:
Extensions sorted by name. If this is by design, it would be nice to have an option to sort them by name if possible.

data.title: File/Folder Watcher fails or out of sync in some cases, e.g. after `typings install something --ambient --save`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. IntelliJ 2016.1 running in background
2. Run in Node.js command prompt: `typings install underscore --ambient --save`
3. Folder is updated in IntelliJ, but Visual Studio Code doesn't show it (until restart or other means)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24123/13886975/1a36d822-ed6c-11e5-9111-f2c5596f23e1.png)

Other people also experience this: https://visualstudio.uservoice.com/forums/293070-visual-studio-code/suggestions/8815939-add-refresh-button-for-files-and-folders

data.title: Store workspace UI state also for empty workspaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VS Code, toggle "Show Side bar" to enabled
2. Close VS Code
3. Double click a file that opens in VS Code

In that instance, the side bar will be disabled again.
